question: Dashkumarcharitam was composed by whom?
explanation:
Dashkumarcharitam was composed by Dandin, who was a Sanskrit author of prose romances and expounder on poetics in the
6th-7th century. The book, Dashkumarcharitam is a prose romance in Sanskrit that describes the adventures of ten young men,Â the Kumaras, all of whom are either princes or sons of royal ministers, as narrated by the men themselves.
